results.title: A ‘Lost City’ Group Chat With Sandra Bullock, Channing Tatum and Daniel Radcliffe
results.abstract: Their movie comedy will be under close scrutiny at the box office. But they aren’t fazed and have lots to say about that Brad Pitt cameo, “Magic Mike” and “Harry Potter.”
des_facet: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child (Play)

multimedia.caption: Tatum, Bullock and Radcliffe say they’re happy that “The Lost City” will be released in theaters but mainly are interested in entertaining audiences no matter the platform.
multimedia.copyright: Amy Harrity for The New York Times

results.title: In Art and Tennis, Watch Out for the Backhand
results.abstract: Jane Campion’s comment about Venus and Serena Williams reminded our critic of his own night of ‘botched fanciness’ and racial slights.

multimedia.caption: The director Jane Campion on Sunday at the Critics Choice Awards, where she was honored for her movie “The Power of the Dog.” The next day she apologized to Venus and Serena Williams for a remark she had made about them in an acceptance speech.

The director Jane Campion on Sunday at the Critics Choice Awards, where she was honored for her movie “The Power of the Dog.” The next day she apologized to Venus and Serena Williams for a remark she had made about them in an acceptance speech.

results.title: ‘X’ Review: Trash, Art and the Movies
results.abstract: Ti West’s latest is a slasher film about the making of a porno film, but the result might not be what you expect.

multimedia.caption: Mia Goth in “X,” from the director Ti West, whose inspirations appear to include “The Texas Chainsaw Massacre” and “Debbie Does Dallas.”

results.abstract: In this gangster exercise set in 1956 Chicago, Mark Rylance plays a tailor who has very large scissors and some sharp moves.

results.title: ‘Alice’ Review: American Slavery and Black Power Collide
results.abstract: This time-bending thriller about a woman who escapes from slavery in 1973, starring Keke Palmer and Common, is a vapid historical romp.

multimedia.caption: Keke Palmer and Common in “Alice.”
Keke Palmer and Common in “Alice.”
Keke Palmer and Common in “Alice.”

results.title: The Secret Sounds of ‘Dune’: Rice Krispies and Marianne Faithfull
results.abstract: Denis Villeneuve and his sound team explain how far they went to achieve an aural experience that would feel somewhat familiar, an unusual approach for sci-fi.
results.byline: By Kyle Buchanan and Peter Fisher

multimedia.caption: Working with sand in Death Valley.
Working with sand in Death Valley.

results.title: ‘Deep Water’ Review: Love and Loathing in New Orleans
results.abstract: An unhappy husband raises suspicions when his wife’s lovers begin to disappear.

results.title: ‘Jane by Charlotte’ Review: A Mother-Daughter Duet
results.abstract: Charlotte Gainsbourg makes her directorial debut with an elusive portrait of her mother, the French-English star Jane Birkin, at age 74.

multimedia.caption: Charlotte Gainsbourg with her mother, Jane Birkin, in “Jane by Charlotte.”
Charlotte Gainsbourg with her mother, Jane Birkin, in “Jane by Charlotte.”

results.title: ‘More Than Robots’ Review: An International Battle
results.abstract: Despite the movie’s title, robots are the subject and spectacle of this lighthearted film about a high school robotics competition.

multimedia.caption: A team competes in “More Than Robots,” a documentary directed by Gillian Jacobs.
A team competes in “More Than Robots,” a documentary directed by Gillian Jacobs.
A team competes in “More Than Robots,” a documentary directed by Gillian Jacobs.

results.title: ‘Intregalde’ Review: Oh, Be Good!
results.abstract: A Romanian satire charts what happens when some humanitarian aid workers set out to save others (and need to be saved themselves).

multimedia.caption: A bump in the road to good works: from left, Ilona Brezoianu, Maria Popistasu and Alex Bogdan in “Intregalde.”
A bump in the road to good works: from left, Ilona Brezoianu, Maria Popistasu and Alex Bogdan in “Intregalde.”
A bump in the road to good works: from left, Ilona Brezoianu, Maria Popistasu and Alex Bogdan in “Intregalde.”

results.title: ‘Ahed’s Knee’ Review: A Filmmaker’s Agony in the Desert
results.abstract: Nadav Lapid’s new film, about a brooding director much like himself, is a howl of rage at the state of Israeli society.

multimedia.caption: Avshalom Pollak, left, and Nur Fibak in “Ahed’s Knee.” The actor is a stand-in for the film’s director, Nadav Lapid.

Avshalom Pollak, left, and Nur Fibak in “Ahed’s Knee.” The actor is a stand-in for the film’s director, Nadav Lapid.

results.title: ‘Love After Love’ Review: Elegance Without a Center
results.abstract: Ann Hui’s World War II-era film is lovely to look at but lacks emotional depth and resonance.

Sandra Ma and Eddie Peng in “Love After Love,” by Ann Hui.

results.title: Mandy Patinkin Finds Healing in Refugee Work and Praying With His Dog
results.abstract: Right when the actor thought he’d done almost everything, Ken Burns offered him the role of Benjamin Franklin, and, just maybe, held off an early retirement.

results.title: ‘Josep’ Review: Escaping a Civil War
results.abstract: The French cartoonist known as Aurel animates the life of the Catalan illustrator Josep Bartolí, who lived in French internment camps and loved Frida Kahlo.

multimedia.caption: The cartoonist Aurel’s debut feature is a hand-drawn film about the life of the Catalan illustrator Josep Bartolí, who left Spain for France in 1939.
The cartoonist Aurel’s debut feature is a hand-drawn film about the life of the Catalan illustrator Josep Bartolí, who left Spain for France in 1939.

results.title: ‘The Last Mountain’ Review: Impossible Summits
results.abstract: This documentary from Chris Terrill struggles to make emotional sense of its story, involving a mother and a son who both died on climbs.

multimedia.caption: The siblings Tom and Kate Ballard in the documentary “The Last Mountain.”
The siblings Tom and Kate Ballard in the documentary “The Last Mountain.”

results.title: Jane Campion Apologizes for Comment About Venus and Serena Williams
results.abstract: In an acceptance speech at the Critics Choice Awards, the “Power of the Dog” filmmaker wrongly suggested that the tennis greats didn’t compete against men the way she had to.

multimedia.caption: Jane Campion at the Critics Choice Awards on Sunday.
Jane Campion at the Critics Choice Awards on Sunday.
Jane Campion at the Critics Choice Awards on Sunday.

results.title: Ari Wegner: A Cinematographer Who Knows Actors Down to the Eyelash
results.abstract: The director of photography for “The Power of the Dog” spent a year on preproduction. Now she could make Oscar history as the first woman to win best cinematography.

multimedia.caption: There’s an unusual closeness between cinematographer and actor, Ari Wegner said: “You’re getting to know their face and their body in a way that is so private and intimate.”
multimedia.copyright: Chantal Anderson for The New York Times

results.title: Stream These 8 Great Performances by William Hurt
results.abstract: A four-time Oscar nominee, the actor played charming, explosive leading men in 1980s classics like “Children of a Lesser God” and “Broadcast News.”

multimedia.caption: William Hurt in “Children of a Lesser God,” from 1986, which earned him his second Oscar nomination.
William Hurt in “Children of a Lesser God,” from 1986, which earned him his second Oscar nomination.
William Hurt in “Children of a Lesser God,” from 1986, which earned him his second Oscar nomination.

results.title: Read Halle Berry’s speech accepting the #SeeHer Award for boundary-pushing.
results.abstract: She said she once aspired to roles played by white men. Now she wants parts that reflect “the reality of my journey, in all of its beauty and all of its pain.”

multimedia.caption: "If we deny our complexity, then we deny our humanity,” Halle Berry said at the ceremony.
"If we deny our complexity, then we deny our humanity,” Halle Berry said at the ceremony.
"If we deny our complexity, then we deny our humanity,” Halle Berry said at the ceremony.

results.title: Maria Bakalova, Billy Crystal and other stars show support for Ukraine.
results.abstract: Most of the Critics Choice ceremony has been focused on prizes, but the war in Ukraine has been addressed in a few ways.

multimedia.caption: Before presenting an award, the “Borat” actress Maria Bakalova spoke of Ukraine, saying, “Our hearts are with you.”
Before presenting an award, the “Borat” actress Maria Bakalova spoke of Ukraine, saying, “Our hearts are with you.”
Before presenting an award, the “Borat” actress Maria Bakalova spoke of Ukraine, saying, “Our hearts are with you.”

results.title: William Hurt, Oscar-Winning Leading Man of the 1980s, Dies at 71
results.abstract: A four-time Academy Award nominee, he starred in such films as “Body Heat,” “The Big Chill,” “Kiss of the Spider Woman” and “Broadcast News.”
results.byline: By Lew Serviss and Neil Genzlinger

multimedia.caption: William Hurt in 2016. A leading man in some of the most popular films of the 1980s, he transitioned to supporting roles in later years.
William Hurt in 2016. A leading man in some of the most popular films of the 1980s, he transitioned to supporting roles in later years.

results.title: ‘The Power of the Dog’ Wins Best Film at Wide-Open BAFTAs
results.abstract: Jane Campion won the best director prize at Britain’s Academy Awards for her tense western in an evening that saw a host of surprise winners.

results.title: Skewering the Anxious Young Things
results.abstract: The film “All My Friends Hate Me” satirizes anxiety and paranoia among upper-class British millennials. Its writers say they are laughing at themselves most of all.

multimedia.caption: In “All My Friends Hate Me,” Pete (Tom Stourton) becomes increasingly convinced his birthday weekend is not a normal celebration.
In “All My Friends Hate Me,” Pete (Tom Stourton) becomes increasingly convinced his birthday weekend is not a normal celebration.
In “All My Friends Hate Me,” Pete (Tom Stourton) becomes increasingly convinced his birthday weekend is not a normal celebration.

results.title: ‘Encanto’ May Be Accurate, but Can It Carry a Whole Country?
results.abstract: The filmmakers behind the Disney hit worked for cultural accuracy. Some Colombians and Colombian Americans are looking for more.

multimedia.caption: The Madrigal family in “Encanto.” The filmmakers convened experts to get the Colombian details correct.
The Madrigal family in “Encanto.” The filmmakers convened experts to get the Colombian details correct.
The Madrigal family in “Encanto.” The filmmakers convened experts to get the Colombian details correct.

results.title: Oscars Rewind: When Rita Moreno Made History and Thanked No One
results.abstract: The actress explains why she gave one of the shortest Academy speeches ever when she became the first Latina to win an acting Oscar 60 years ago.

multimedia.caption: Rita Moreno with the Oscar statuette she didn’t expect to win.
Rita Moreno with the Oscar statuette she didn’t expect to win.
Rita Moreno with the Oscar statuette she didn’t expect to win.

results.title: ‘My Cousin Vinny’ at 30: An Unlikely Oscar Winner
results.abstract: Much like Vinny in the South, the film was a fish out of water at the Academy Awards. But the comedy endures, thanks to a generous Joe Pesci and a fiery Marisa Tomei.

multimedia.caption: Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei in the courtroom in “My Cousin Vinny.”
Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei in the courtroom in “My Cousin Vinny.”

results.abstract: This month’s picks include an otherworldly Mexican comedy, a tale of repressed romance from Georgia and an elliptical Brazilian thriller.

results.title: Alec Baldwin Seeks to Avoid Liability in Fatal ‘Rust’ Shooting
results.abstract: In an arbitration demand against his fellow producers on the film, he denied culpability in the killing of a cinematographer and said he should not be held financially responsible.
results.byline: By Graham Bowley and Julia Jacobs

multimedia.caption: The church set in New Mexico where Alec Baldwin shot and killed the cinematographer Halyna Hutchins with a gun he had been told held no live ammunition.
The church set in New Mexico where Alec Baldwin shot and killed the cinematographer Halyna Hutchins with a gun he had been told held no live ammunition.
